title: Casal do Conde 2014 Galileu Tinto Red (Tejo)
description: The wine is soft, light and stalky. It is made to be drunk young with its fresh red berry fruits, acidity and only a minimum of tannins. Drink now.

title: Vivanco 2014 White (Rioja)
description: A light tan color and dusty sweaty aromas of apricot, matchstick and onion set up a clampy, pithy, citrusy palate. Flavors of nectarine and orange are mild, low on stuffing and grabby on the finish.

title: Adega de Cantanhede 2014 Marquês de Marialva Colheita Seleccionada White (Bairrada)
description: The wine is soft, lightly textured and perfumed. It has yellow fruits and ripe pear flavors along with a touch of ginger and spice. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2014 Lote 44 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Big, raisiny and obtuse up front, this fully extracted Malbec is heavy on the palate, with raisin, prune and cassis flavors that show interior notes of green herbs. This tastes minty, herbal and hot on the finish, with barely any freshness.

title: Pablo Claro 2014 Special Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Melon and cidery aromas are distant. This feels low on acidity, while pear, papaya and briny flavors taste bitter on the back end of the palate. A briny, pickled note marks the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Ivory and Burt 2012 Red (Lodi)
description: Bold aromas of bread dough and strong flavors of herbs and stewed fruit flavors compete for attention. This wine is medium bodied, smooth in texture and rustic in flavor.

title: Casal do Conde 2014 Galileu Branco White (Tejo)
description: A light and gently fruity perfumed wine, this has easy flavors of spice, pears and soft acidity. It is ready to drink.

title: Del Rio 2013 Estate Grown Merlot (Rogue Valley)
description: This pure varietal seems underripe, with scents of mushrooms and tar, and no fruit in sight. The finish turns bitter, with dry tannins.

title: Campelo 2014 White (Vinho Verde)
description: Almost bubbly with a lively mousse, this is a tangy citrus and apple flavored wine that is unfortunately unbalanced with an artificial sweetness at the end.

title: Quattrocchi 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Grapy candied berry aromas mix with loud oak that smells like clove and mint. This has a narrow astringent mouthfeel and strange-tasting berry flavors that end with a rugged finish.

title: Abadía de Tortoreos 2013 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Nothing on the bottle says this is oaked, but this Albariño smells like burnt plywood and sawdust. It's chunky and fat on the palate, with woody melony flavors that finish salty and dried out.

title: Armanino Family Cellars 2013 The Ringneck Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A generous body and oak stand out most in this wine, which leans sour in tannin and bittersweet chocolate more than fruit. A forest-floor component keeps it savory, with a taste of yeasty bread.

title: Del Rio 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Rogue Valley)
description: Tannic and earthy, this is dominated by the scents and flavors of dried mushrooms. There are hints of fruit leather, and not much else.

title: Del Rio 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)
description: Redolent of mushrooms and forest-floor aromas, this barely hints at fruit, and what is there could be any thin, generic red wine.

title: Black Ink 2013 Red (California)
description: This medium-bodied red has a dark, inky color. It smells smoky, and offers flavors that are simple, grapy and very oaky. The texture is quite tannic.

title: Bodega Zafado 2015 Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Resiny oak sticks out, while the palate is grabby and sticky in feel. This tastes like lemony pushcart hotdogs and the briny water they sit in, followed by a woody, low-fruit finish.

title: Le Haut Païs 2014 Merlot (Périgord)
description: This wine is soft and juicy without great focus. It has a light feel, with fresh jammy red fruits and a gentle breeze of tannins. Drink now.

title: Quinta do Arrobe 2012 Oculto Red (Tejo)
description: A wine that is strangely hollow with structure and juicy fruit around a hole in the center. Spice and red berry flavors are contrasted with dry tannins that may not soften.

title: Headbanger 2013 Rock n Red Red (California)
description: Very ripe and obviously fruity aromas and flavors are coated with sweet-seeming oak notes that resemble vanilla and maple syrup. The wine is medium bodied and just moderately tannic.

title: Twisted Cedar 2013 Moscato (Clarksburg)
description: This medium-bodied and sugary tasting wine has lots of apple and pear flavors. The texture is soft and the finish very sweet.

title: Bootstrap 2013 Red (California)
description: Cedar aromas and raisin and prune flavors are bold in this full-bodied, fresh but rather rustic wine.

title: Budeguer 2009 Patrimonio Seleccion de Barricas Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This is overripe and raisiny, no two ways about it. Hailing from a very hot year, this feels flat and flabby, while raisin and prune are the dominant flavors. Blatant overripeness and a ton of weight render this out of balance.

title: Pampa 2013 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Spearmint and weedy red-fruit aromas lead to raw palate. This is more herbal than fruity, with a lean rubbery finish.

title: Fillaboa 2013 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Mature mealy apricot aromas lead to a spent palate with unfocused cidery flavors that taste old and demanding. This finishes heavy, pulpy and without much point or pleasure. Albariño is meant to be fresh and friendly, but this is neither.

title: Charles B. Mitchell NV Bella Rossa Italian Style Red (Fair Play)
description: This is a straightforward, plummy, raisiny wine with medium body and an earthy, tomato-like touch in the flavors. It will be good for very casual occasions.

title: Michel Torino 2014 Cuma Made With Organic Grapes Malbec (Cafayate)
description: Rustic tomato and cherry aromas make for a scratchy opening. This is wiry and grating in feel, with sour plum and red-currant flavors. A fresh but scratchy and herbal tasting finish isn't exactly friendly.

title: Mont Paral NV Reserva Selection Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Leesy aromas of tropical fruits feed into a flat palate. Leesy but bland peach and melon flavors lack conviction and finish sketchy, with nothing in particular standing out. This is the definition of a marginal Cava.

title: Peñascal 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Aromas of canned peas and beans indicate this was probably fresher smelling nine months ago. Zesty and solid on the palate, this tastes oily, pyrazinic and briny, with stone fruit notes.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2014 Terra de Touros Arinto (Tejo)
description: A gentle light wine that seems diluted. It has only hints of fruit and acidity, all very easy and ripe to drink. The wine is ready.

title: Hinman 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: This wine has a perceptible tawny tone despite its youth, and the scents also seem to suggest that the wine is slightly oxidized. Whiffs of sherry and apple cider lead into a soft, flat, rather dull palate of nondescript fruit.
